function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Under-ascertainment of infections 40-50%"},{"name":"Assumption of short-term immunity after recovery"},{"name":"30% of hospitalised cases requiring critical care"},{"name":"Overall mean duration of hospitalisation of 10.4 days"},{"name":"Ifr estimates at 0.9% 95% credible interval 0.4%-1.4%"},{"name":"Uncontrolled spread of infectious diseases"},{"name":"Assumptions leading to underestimation of risks"},{"name":"Unmitigated epidemic with predicted deaths"},{"name":"Delay in initiating social distancing and closure of schools and universities"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the reproduction number r0 and severity of the virus"},{"name":"Prolonged implementation of social distancing measures"},{"name":"Relaxation of social distancing measures may lead to a resurgence of transmission and new waves of infection."},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of home isolation and school closures may lead to continued transmission within households and educational institutions."},{"name":"Large uncertainties around transmission of the virus and policy effectiveness"},{"name":"Spontaneous adoption of risk-reducing behaviors uncertain"},{"name":"Evolution of measures for suppression may lead to decreased efficiency of containment"},{"name":"Inability to sustain intensive npi packages for suppression may lead to rapid transmission rebound"},{"name":"Risk of ineffective epidemic suppression due to school and university closures"},{"name":"Delay in seeing the impact of interventions on hospitalised case numbers"},{"name":"Ineffective mitigation strategies may lead to overwhelming the healthcare system capacity"},{"name":"Relaxation of control measures leading to virus spread"},{"name":"Limited testing capacity leading to underestimation of true infections"},{"name":"Uncertainty in initial reproduction numbers"},{"name":"Uncertainty in estimating intervention impact"},{"name":"Statistical impossibility of determining the greatest effect of interventions"},{"name":"Inability of the model without interventions to capture recent trends in deaths"},{"name":"Lag between infections and deaths"},{"name":"Changes in adherence to interventions affecting forecast of future deaths"},{"name":"Lack of certainty in the effectiveness of non-pharmaceutical interventions in countries at earlier stages of the epidemic."},{"name":"Implicit lag in time affecting intervention impact on deaths"},{"name":"Inaccurate country-specific estimates of attack rate by age"},{"name":"Uncertainty in infection model"},{"name":"Inadequate handling of serial interval distribution"},{"name":"Country-specific reproduction number variability"},{"name":"Inaccurate estimation of reproduction number due to prior assumptions"},{"name":"Inadequate preparation for initial seeding of infections"},{"name":"Lag between deaths and infections in data interpretation"},{"name":"Sensitivity of estimates to serial interval distribution"},{"name":"Implausible uninformative prior distributions on intervention effects"},{"name":"Lack of self-isolation measures for individuals with cough or fever symptoms"},{"name":"Unreliable estimates of infection rates due to testing variations and early data collection"},{"name":"Difficulties in detecting relationships between physical environments, exposures, behaviors, and health outcomes"},{"name":"Potential for increased covid-19 spread due to lack of social distancing"},{"name":"Difficulty in measuring early infection rates"},{"name":"Fluid nature of covid-19 data, especially the resurgence of the virus in the united states during winters"},{"name":"Obesity linked to chronic diseases and increased risk of covid-19 mortality"},{"name":"Significant variation in fatality rate across counties"},{"name":"Variation in associations of variables with covid-19 fatality rate across counties"},{"name":"Variations in associations between covid-19 fatality rate and obesity across different counties"},{"name":"Heterogeneity in testing rate and covid-19 mortality"}]}
